intro: Pisum sativum var. praecox, commonly known as early pea, is a cultivated variety of the pea plant that matures earlier than the standard pea. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and shorter flowering and fruiting periods. The plant produces pods that are typically green and contain several edible seeds. It thrives in cool climates and is often grown as a spring crop. Its botanical features include trifoliate leaves and a climbing habit, though some varieties may be bushy.
